items.description:
IPFS is an open-source project that encourages the development of multiple implementations of the protocol, each of which seeks to optimize for various use cases.
Check out the list of IPFS implementations in the IPFS docs.
items.title: Implementations

items.description: A minimal web browser for the distributed web. Supports downloading/uploading data from IPFS using the browser's  API
items.title: Agregore

items.description: Anytype is a no-code, modular web builder designed to give ownership back to creators. It's built on our private, local-first, p2p-synced and open Anysync protocol.
items.title: Anytype

items.description: A High-Fidelity Web Archiving Extension for Chrome and Chromium based browsers with support for IPFS.
items.title: archiveweb.page

items.description: Autonomica is a Keybase-like Dapp for creating an identity and proving this identity via published social media and web proofs.
items.title: Autonomica "IPFS Social Proof"

items.description: File synchronization with git like interface and FUSE filesystem.
items.title: brig

items.description: Play music from your IPFS node, or any other cloud/distributed storage service you use.
items.title: Diffuse

items.description: Mobile app for accessing and uploading content on the IPFS network.
items.title: Durin

items.description: Hardbin is an encrypted pastebin, with the decryption key passed in the URL fragment
items.title: Hardbin

items.description: A Lightweight VPN Built on top of IPFS + Libp2p for Truly Distributed Networks.
items.title: hyprspace

items.description: Web Archive (WARC) indexing and replay using IPFS.
items.title: InterPlanetary Wayback

items.description: Wiki built on top of IPFS
items.title: Interplanetary Wiki

items.description: A simple way to publish uncensorable essays on IPFS.
items.title: IPFessay

items.description: IPFS Desktop gives you all the power of IPFS in a convenient desktop app: a complete IPFS node, plus handy OS menubar/taskbar shortcuts and an all-in-one file manager, peer map, and content explorer.
items.title: IPFS Desktop

items.description: Share files directly from the browser using IPFS.
items.title: IPFS Share

items.description: Terminal-based, encrypted chatrooms. Allows private messaging & secure in-chat file/directory sharing. Server/broker-less (no signaling/rendezvous server needed). Works over LAN/internet(w/ NAT-traversal).
items.title: ipfs-chat

items.description: A completely decentralized first person shooter. Built with Unity, Fleek, Unstoppable Domans and Pinata.
items.title: IPFS-FPS

items.description: A censorship resistant deadman's switch
items.title: killcord

items.description: Mintter Hypermedia is an open system, built on IPFS, that allows communities to collaborate on content that is structured and deeply linked. All content in the system is cryptographically signed, versioned, and made permanent with IPFS.
items.title: Mintter

items.description: Ultra simple chatrooms on the web.
items.title: orbitchat.dev

items.description: Peer to Peer Web Site hosting at your fingertips! Send full featured HTML (incl. CSS, JS) sites from your browser and attach files eg. videos, images, etc.
items.title: Peer Web Site

items.description: End-to-end encrypted, peer-to-peer file storage and sharing.
items.title: Peergos

items.description: Build and host decentralized blogs and websites with IPFS on your Mac
items.title: Planet

items.description: Plebbit is a serverless, adminless, decentralised and infinitely scalable Social Media platform that is peer-to-peer and open-source.It's built on top of IPFS, Gossipsub and Blockchain namesystems (ENS, SNS).
items.title: Plebbit

items.description: Push to Talk lets you edit audio essays and publish them with IPFS.
items.title: PushToTalk

items.description: Privacy focused, end-to-end encrypted chat app that runs a private IPFS network over Tor connections. Desktop and mobile iOS and Android apps available.
items.title: Quiet

items.description: A fully static distributed library system powered by IPFS, SQLite and GitHub.
items.title: TeaTime

items.description: A list of web browsers with IPFS integrations
A minimal web browser for the distributed web. Supports downloading/uploading data from IPFS using the browser's  API
items.title: Agregore

items.description: A privacy-focused browser with many future forward features.
items.title: Brave

items.description: A multi-platform Qt5-based browser for the distributed web.
items.title: galacteek

items.description: Opera browser added support for  in 2021
items.title: Opera
Browsers

items.description: Set up a decentralized web3 app by running one command.
items.title: create-ipfs-app

items.description: A browser extension that uploads the content to Web3.Storage and generates QR codes for CIDs.
items.title: dScan

items.description: A decentralized encrypted backup agent for popular databases supported by IPFS and Filecoin.
items.title: dump-ipfs

items.description: Adds support for deploying Gatsby websites to IPFS by ensuring that assets are relative.
items.title: gatsby-plugin-ipfs

items.description: A script to rehost your git repos in ipfs.
items.title: git-ipfs-rehost

items.description: push/pull repositories from/to IPFS.
items.title: git-remote-ipfs

items.description: set of programs written in Python 3 which allow Git user to clone, push, fetch, self-host or release Git repositories over IPFS decentralized data storage system.
items.title: Git IPFS Remote Bridge

items.description: This is a Golang port of OrbitDB that intends to be fully compatible with the original JavaScript version. OrbitDB is a serverless, distributed, peer-to-peer database.
items.title: go-orbit-db

items.description: IPFS and libp2p on Mobile, with Gomobile.
items.title: gomobile-ipfs

items.description: This is a simple webtool to add URLs to an IPFS node.
items.title: http2ipfs

items.description: IPFS-backed Docker Registry.
items.title: IPDR

items.description: A GitHub Action to install and initialize go-ipfs to provision a cross-platform test environment on GitHub's CI platform.
items.title: IPFS Setup Action

items.description: GitHub Action for delivery of static websites.
items.title: ipfs-action

items.description: Encrypt a file or directory with AES256 then add to IPFS.
items.title: ipfs-add-from-encrypted

items.description: Publish IPFS webapps which require user consent to update.
items.title: IPFS-boot

items.description: Browser extension that simplifies access to IPFS resources.
items.title: ipfs-companion

items.description: Zero-config CLI to deploy static websites: cd my-static-website && npx @agentofuser/ipfs-deploy
items.title: ipfs-deploy

items.description: Mount IPFS as a mapped drive on Windows.
items.title: ipfs-mount

items.description: Paste stdin and clipboard to IPFS.
items.title: ipfs-paste

items.description: A toolkit help upload files to IPFS pinning services.
items.title: ipfs-pinner

items.description: Continuous Delivery tool for delivery of static websites from Git providers to IPFS.
items.title: ipfs-publish

items.description: Capture screenshots, publish them to IPFS, and copy the link to the clipboard.
items.title: ipfs-screencap

items.description: Cloud-init your own IPFS gateway on a cloud provider and easily pin content through a simple web interface.
items.title: ipfs-video-gateway

items.description: Encrypt and decrypt IPFS files with a secret passphrase.
items.title: ipfsecret

items.description: satellite: wget for IPFS: retrieve files over IPFS and save them locally.
items.title: ipget

items.description: Explore the Merkle Forest from the comfort of your browser.
items.title: IPLD Explorer

items.description: A command-line tool to pin stuff via ipns.
items.title: ipns-pin

items.description: Browser userscript for redirecting IPFS/IPNS addresses to your local gateway. This should work on any browser that hasn't had an extension written for it yet and has support for userscripts.
items.title: IPRedirect

items.description: IETF RFC downloader which stores RFCs on IPFS and indexes them with RTradeLtd/Lens.
items.title: iprfc

items.description: Mahuta is a plug and play service for your micro-service architecture allowing to collect, store and index data on IPFS and offering search functionalities (full text, query).
items.title: mahuta

items.description: Multiverse is a decentralized version control system that enables peer-to-peer software development.
items.title: Multiverse

items.description: The ultimate decentralized website deployment toolkit.
items.title: Omnipin

items.description: OrbitDB is a serverless, distributed, peer-to-peer database that uses IPFS as its data storage and IPFS Pubsub to automatically sync databases with peers.
items.title: orbit-db

items.description: Web Extension which creates a WebArchiveZip of a tweet and adds to IPFS network.
items.title: Pin Tweet to IPFS

items.description: Checks which public gateways are online or not.
items.title: Public Gateway Checker

items.description: A toolkit makes it easier to archive webpages to IPFS.
items.title: rivet

items.description: Decentralized Solidity contract source code verification service
items.title: sourcify

items.description: A twitter bot that adds, pins, unpins your tweets to public IPFS network using IPFS Cluster.
items.title: SimpleAsWater Bot

items.description: Using Solid to store IPFS Hash privately or publicly.
items.title: solid-ipfs

items.description: Encrypt files before uploading them using a keypair or a passphrase.
items.title: Tellit

items.description: Publish your Vue apps easily to IPFS.
items.title: VIPFS

items.description: A command-line tool and Go package interface for wayback webpage to IPFS.
items.title: wbipfs

items.description: Download videos from YouTube (and similar video platforms) and add them to IPFS.
items.title: youtube2ipfs

items.description:
We maintain a list of no longer maintained projects for reference. If you see something on this list that's no longer maintained, please submit a PR moving the entry into stale.md and optionally add the reason why it's marked as stale with an indented comment.
View the list of stale projects here
items.title: Stale Projects

items.description:
Contributions are welcome!
See the Contribution Guidelines.
items.title: Contribute
